sub_title: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor
summary:
Consultant with 20 years experience leading and advising legal reform, justice and development projects in Eastern Europe, South Caucasus, Turkey, United States and the Netherlands. Designed and directed educational and policy initiatives, conducted project evaluations, legal and field research, managed an international development program and a multinational team from 15 countries, founded a public advocacy center in post-conflict Sarajevo and was Executive Director of a NGO in Washington, DC. Legal Advisor for international organizations, NGOs and startups. Licensed attorney with an environmental and social justice background, a LLM in Public International Law and a Juris Doctor. Seeking new projects.

- Expertise in legal and institutional reform, organizational development, program management and capacity building. 
- Practical experience advising and managing programs in every stage- from startup through transition.
- Effective financial and project manager, comfortable with responsibility for all aspects of multi million-euro programs from human resources and legal compliance through grant writing and administration, project design and implementation, monitoring and evaluation. 
- Proven capacity to solve problems, manage and adapt programming to achieve results in dynamic environments.
- Fully authorized to work in the United States and the Netherlands.

education.field_of_study: Public International Law -Peace, Justice and Development Specialization

school.name: The George Washington University Law School

certifications.name: CELTA  (Certificate in English Language Teaching to Adults)

projects.title: 2019 United Nations Resolution 74/5 - The International Day for Universal Access to Information
projects.description: I co-founded the Freedom of Information Advocates Network, an international network of advocates sharing expertise and ideas to promote public access to information, in 2002. Over the years it has expanded and in October 2019, the network's founding date was proclaimed by United Nations resolution as The International Day for Universal Access to Information, an annual day celebrating FOI laws and the Aarhus Convention.

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Capacity building of election authorities
projects.description: Press Release - Representatives from the Macedonian State Election Commission, the judiciary, prosecution office and the Interior Ministry discuss ways to better respond to potential irregularities during the electoral process at the roundtable supported by the OSCE Spillover Monitor Mission to Skopje, taking place today. The project which is also supported by the domestic Foundation Open Society Institute FOSIM and implemented by the Coalition All for Fair Trials, is designed to contribute towards fair and democratic electoral process and respect of rule of law in the country. “This event coincides with the pre-election period because it gives us the opportunity to emphasize the importance of proper institutional responses to election irregularities,” said Lisa Tilney, Mission’s Head of Rule of Law Department. The forum participants address institutional responses against all kind of violations of the electoral process and will also tackle the issues of family and proxy voting and the role of women in the elections. Skopje, 26 February 2009 (MIA)

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Handbooks on new criminal procedure law
projects.description: Press Release - The OSCE Mission to Skopje today launched five handbooks that look at new aspects of the revised Law on Criminal Procedure. The  Mission to Skopje published the handbooks to help ensure that the procedure in criminal cases is unified and standardized at all levels of the judiciary. SKOPJE, 21 April 2011

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Legal analysis: independence of the judiciary
projects.description: Press Release - This OSCE Spillover Monitor Mission to Skopje analysis presents the findings of a countrywide survey on the independence of the judiciary as perceived and experienced by the judges of the host country. SKOPJE, 31 December 2009

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Training for civil society organizations to improve identification and reporting of hate crimes
projects.description: Press Release - Some 30 members of civil society organizations participated in a two-day training event on how to improve reporting on hate crimes, which was organized by the OSCE Mission to Skopje and the OSCE’s Office for Democratisation and Human Rights. The attendees – members of civil society organizations active in the fields of human rights protection; trial monitoring; free legal aid; assistance to victims of police abuse; and the protection of Roma rights – were trained on how to better identity, monitor and report hate crimes and hate speech. Key elements of hate crimes and the relationship to freedom of expression and freedom of religion were also discussed. At the same event, the interactive web portal www.zlostorstvaodomraza.com was presented, which is used to document occurrences of hate crimes and hate incidents. Individuals and groups can report any concerns or incidents of hate crimes on the site, seek assistance, and use the portal as a source of information. SKOPJE, 27 May 2013

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Training in identifying cases of trafficking for labour exploitation
projects.description: Press Release - An OSCE Mission-supported workshop on identifying cases of trafficking in human beings for the purpose of labour exploitation started in Bitola today. The two-day training course for some 100 labour inspectors and social workers from around the country is the second in a series of four workshops. "Often the crime of trafficking for labour exploitation remains largely invisible, with a low number of properly identified and criminally prosecuted cases. The main reasons for this are the lack of awareness and low capacity on the part of law-enforcement agencies, mainly state labour inspectors with responsibility for identification of cases,"​ says Lisa Tilney, the Head of the OSCE Mission's Rule of Law Department. "These workshops aim to support labour inspectors and social workers to gain the skills they need." SKOPJE, 23 November 2009

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Training of legal practitioners on new criminal procedure code
projects.description: Press Release - The OSCE Mission to Skopje is holding its final basic training course for legal practitioners and law enforcement officials on the new adversarial and parties-driven criminal procedure from 29 November through 2 December 2012. The course is part of a two-year training cycle under an OSCE-supported project. Throughout the two years more than 900 judges, public prosecutors, attorneys, legal associates and enforcement officials received basic training on the new criminal procedure, in order to be able to effectively implement the new Law when it comes into force in December next year. SKOPJE, 29 November 2012

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Training on law-making for civil servants
projects.description: Press Release - The OSCE Mission to Skopje and the Ministry of Information Society and Administration marked the completion of a project in Skopje on 12 December 2012 that was aimed at strengthening the lawmaking capacity of the public administration. Some 40 civil servants took part in the course to enhance their knowledge and competence in complex policy-making procedures and techniques, as well as legal drafting in order to ensure quality, effectiveness, transparency and inclusiveness in the law-making process. The law-making course will be incorporated into the generic training programme for all civil servants. Under the project, a distance e-learning course was also developed with OSCE support. It is now administered by the Ministry and will be used for further professional development of all administration staff. The OSCE has also expanded its support to cover law-drafting standards and access to legislation in the country. In addition, a new legal framework for ex post evaluation of the implementation of laws was developed to enable national authorities to assess whether the intended results are being achieved and public goals are being reached. SKOPJE, 12 December 2012

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Trees + Clean Air Campaign
projects.description: This project was designed to foster the dialogue about tree canopy expansion as air quality improvement and climate change mitigation strategies. It involved collaboration among state and federal agencies, environmental organizations and city governments to include tree plantings in air and water quality improvement plans. It included educational initiatives in 5 states, resource and policy development that saw the incorporation of innovative strategies into state law.

contributors.headline: Senior Program Director ⋆ Rule of Law Expert ⋆ Legal Advisor

projects.title: Varied support for the establishment of a national mechanism for anti-discrimination
projects.description: Press Release - A high-level OSCE-supported conference which started in Skopje today will discuss the establishment of an effective national mechanism for protection from discrimination. The event, organized by the OSCE Spillover Monitor Mission to Skopje, will offer participants from various state institutions, including the Labour and Social Policy Ministry, Justice Ministry, Ombudsman Institute, Members of Parliament and the President's Cabinet, as well as from civil society, an opportunity to share best practices and exchange ideas on the composition and structure of a commission for protection from discrimination. The creation of such an equality body is envisioned in the national law on anti-discrimination. SKOPJE, 21 June 2010
